title: Christmas at Moose Factory
creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: Children’s crayon drawings, and the voice of a little girl telling what the pictures are about, create a charming study of life at Christmas time in Moose Factory, an old settlement, mainly of Indian families, on the shore of James Bay. Incidents big and small are illustrated and described with childish candor, conveying to the viewer a strong sense of being there. Suitable for primary school level.
